# Weber's dwarf squirrel

| genus = Prosciurillus
| species = weberi
| authority = (Jentink, 1890)
| synonyms =
}}
'''Weber's dwarf squirrel (Prosciurillus weberi') is a species of rodent in the family Sciuridae. It is endemic to northern and western Sulawesi, Indonesia. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical dry forests.
References
*Thorington, R. W. Jr. and R. S. Hoffman. 2005. Family Sciuridae. pp. 754â€“818 in'' Mammal Species of the World a Taxonomic and Geographic Reference. D. E. Wilson and D. M. Reeder eds. Johns Hopkins University Press, Baltimore.

---
